At the end of their journey, the Great Oz provides the Scarecrow with a brain made of needles, the Tin Woodman a heart of sawdust, and the Lion a drink that grants him courage. The joyful reaction of her companions to these changes perks Dorothy's inquisitive nature even more.

"Can I see inside your head," Dorothy asked the Scarecrow. Though a bit nervous, her friend replied: "Sure. As long you fill it back up with straw again." Dorothy answered in a hearty voice, "leave it to me," and placed her hand over her heart.

Next, Dorothy asked the Tin Woodsman to show her his insides. The Woodsman made a hesitant gesture and then answered, "Make sure to oil me up again when you're done, so I can move." "Of course," said Dorothy with a smile.

The Lion shivered with fear. This despite having received courage from the Great Oz. "Will you show me your insides, too?" Dorothy asked, standing beside the dismembered Scarecrow and Woodsman with a gleam in her eyes.

Old Woman's Diary Monday (Clear Skies)\nFound a pair of lost siblings in the forest and brought them home.\nThey were overjoyed when I made them lots of sweets and they said my home was like a "house made of candy".

Old Woman's Diary Tuesday (Clear Skies)\nThe children are most well behaved. They help with many chores around the house.\nOccasionally, they huddle in secret about to discuss something. They seem very close.

Old Woman's Diary Thursday (Cloudy)\nI listened in on the children's conversations. They refer to me as a witch.\nThey say that I'm going to eat them! Such terrible delusions. And after I helped them!
Old Woman's Diary Saturday (Rainy)\nI almost got trapped in the furnace. These children frighten me.\nThey were laughing as I panicked. One day, they're actually going to kill me...
From "Case File on the Murder of the King of Crows by the Scarecrow"\nScarecrow: I didn't do anything wrong. I merely wrung its neck to protect Dorothy.
From "Case File on the Murder of the Wolf by the Tin Woodsman"\nWoodsman: I killed forty wolves with forty swings of my axe.\nKilling brought me to tears, but if it's for Dorothy... It must be done.
From "Case File on the Murder of the Giant Spider by the Lion"\nLion: It's the Giant Spider's fault for getting in Dorothy's way.\nDorothy was quite pleased when I severed its head.

According to the statements of the Scarecrow, the Woodsman, and the Lion, in each case, we find the presence of a girl named Dorothy, also wanted for questioning as a material witness in the squashing of the Witch of the East, as well as the murder and dismemberment of the Witch of the West.
More, more, more. It's not enough. I am not satisfied.\nAhh, what can I do? Pain itself is my only joy.\nYet my body—my body is too tough to feel pain any longer.

...If strength is an obstacle, perhaps I should bind myself?\nI shall tie my hands and legs, then tighten the bindings until they bleed.\nThen you shall tease me. Then you shall look down on me, as I desire!
I must become more powerless. My body must resemble a pile of dirty rags.\nI shall block my eyes, plug my ears, and sew my mouth shut. Every inch of me shall be stitched!

I shall be powerless to act, powerless to see, powerless to hear. I shall roll like a discarded rock. \nI shall feel only endless pain and boundless joy. \nI no longer need anything else. Nothing but this pleasure—

On the dawn of the 22nd, a mother in the city reported finding her son collapsed on the floor of their home with slit wrists. The boy was carried to the emergency room but died soon later. The death is being looked at as a suicide.

News digest (with video): This boy-daughter who killed himself is too cute.\n1. [Anonymous] "So this is the one who committed suicide. He looks like a Gothic Lolita type."\n2. [Anonymous] "This is a loss for all humanity. Cuteness is a virtue after all."

2. [Anonymous] "I went to the funeral. Boring service. But that suits the Gothic Lolita style, right?!\nI got interviewed and I said, 'he was a nice boy, kind to everyone' (laugh). I didn't even know him. (laugh) The mother had psychotic eyes."

Update. What was initially seen as the suicide of a young boy in his home is now confirmed as murder at the hands of his mother. The mother is said to be mentally compromised, and further psychological evaluation must be undertaken before carefully—

This just in, regarding the case of XX Hospital, where several suspicious patient deaths have been reported. A nurse has confessed to the crime after submitting to voluntary questioning by the police. \nThe police arrested her on the spot and are now probing her means and motive.

The nurse suspected of responsibility for a series of patient deaths has stated that "neither she nor the victims did anything wrong" and has appealed to the righteousness of her actions. \nPolice are considering a psychological evaluation as part of their investigation.

According to sources inside the investigation, there had been frequent trouble between the suspect and the victims. Coworkers have stated that the hospital has many patients suffering from Alzheimer's disease and that this became a common excuse for the incidents.

The suspect in the series of suspicious patient deaths has died. Reports are that the suspect escaped from police custody as they were conducting an inspection of the crime scene and leaped from the roof of the hospital. \nQuestions are being asked about the supervision of police on the scene—
Q: Now then, a question… What is the appeal of werewolf cosplay? \nA: I love the variety of all the tragic characters you can play. \nAh, but of course, none is as tragic as the Little Mermaid…

Q: What did you think of the Werewolf Game as a theme?\n A: The way the villagers suspected and murdered each other… A game this cruel and \npathetic is unbearable. ...I'd love to introduce it to the undersea kingdom.
Q: You frown in every picture. Please smile more!\nA: But that's… Why force me to smile...? And what's more,\n the camera is always shot from a low angle. Oh, I'm so miserable…!

Q: Do you have any advice for people who want to try cosplay like you? \nA: The important thing is to become emotionally involved in the story. You must become the character \nand act as they would. If it's a tragedy, you must drown yourself in pain…
Q: I see, and how did you begin werewolf cosplay? \nA: In terms of playing roles and deceiving others, I've been\n doing that forever by playing the docile, subservient Cinderella.
Q: What did you think of the Werewolf Game as a theme?\nA: People betraying and killing each other. Very nice. I love it. \nBut if that's the game, shouldn't they be more thorough about it?

Q: Those animal ears suit you well. you look like a real wolf. \nA: A wolf… I see. But they always get killed at the end of the story.\nIs that what you think should happen to me? ...You have some nerve to say that.
Q: Some final words for the readers please.\nA: Do you enjoy seeing me dressed like a beast? You all don't need a costume.\nYou've always been bunch of slovenly pigs. Ahaha!

Once upon a time, in an age when humans and gods crossed paths, the honorable young ruler of a savage kingdom stepped between the people and the gods to lead. The ruler was known as the Lion King and did much to heal the kingdom, earning the deep love of the people.

It was then that a priest discovered an omen of coming misfortune. He quickly reported his finding to the King. The King conducted a ceremony with the court magician, but the omen did not disappear. Despite the numerous remonstrances of the priest, the King paid no heed and began a war with a neighboring kingdom to expand his territory. Victory was achieved.

The Lion King's arrogance did not end there. His reign grew tyrannical and the wars were constant. The soldiers and people suffered from exhaustion. The King punished the remonstrant priest and put his head on display. In response, the soldiers and people rebelled, surrounding the castle.

Records say that when the King's head was severed, it cast a deformed shadow resembling a lion. The Kingdom plunged into ruin and he was known by future generations as "the damned". Only the faintest trace of his reign now remains.

This story took place long ago. Once, I was a beautiful raven with feathers of pure black. But I was not satisfied. To be ever more beautiful, I began wearing a ruby necklace. I received it from a woman who lived in a red-roofed house.

The woman you see now is a fool who knows only vanity. She maintained her beauty with repeated cosmetic surgery and used her position as the secretary for the president of a major corporation to become rich. She was a shallow woman whose only satisfaction came from money, makeup, and compliments.

The secretary cared only for her own appearance and neglected her home. She didn't even maintain her ventilation system. It corroded to the point that even I could pass through it by opening a hole with my beak.

On that day, I carried an emerald ring in my beak and tried to escape through the broken vents. That's when it happened. Someone flipped a switch inside the house. Right at my side, I heard the fan begin to spin.
Oh, bruises red, blue and black. Your pain washes the lies away. Wound after wound after wound. \nWarm, throbbing pain. Bruises that will soon disappear. \nPeel the scabs and let the blood flow.
I want to feel a loss so strong, broken and empty. \nThe power soothes my body as it spreads.\n I want to feel the ecstatic joy as my body bends.
Thrust and pound! So deep, it can never be undone. Pain! Numbness! \nSo deep it can never be undone. Terror! Slice away! So deep it can't be undone. I must feel the fear, feel the agony!

One day, my wish will come true. 　　　　\nTo be beaten, shot, bound, numbed, drowned, kicked, torn, drained of blood, burned… till I lose myself and reach heaven.\n　　　Under a blue, blue moon, I dream and dream again.
One pig, two pigs, three baby pigs. They devour, fatten, and wretch.\nThe eldest, next eldest, and youngest. Devour, fatten, and wretch.\nBreakfast, lunch, and dinner. Devour, fatten, and wretch.

Go ahead and eat some more. Munch munch, chomp chomp, chew and grind.\nAh, I've gained weight again. Glistening fat, quivering belly, shaking like a bowl of jelly.\nNow let it out. Vomit. Wretch, ewww, blegh.
If we could continue eating forever, we would always be happy.\nBut the fat sticks to our bones, it envelops us.\nAnd that's why the vomit never stops. It continues forever.
Meat within the mouth. Meat in the belly. Meat thrown up in vomit.\nAll of them, all of it, so good, so tasty, so tough!\nAll together now, one two three. Devour, fatten, and wretch—

What have I done wrong? I only did what was necessary to live. \nThose who scratched and scoffed, those who looked down on me… I gave them what they deserved. \nIf that makes me evil, than the word evil must be the highest of compliments!
Jealousy, envy, resentment, spite. They all feel so good! \nThe way you grind your teeth so\n is evidence of nothing more than my victory!
You there, show me your bitterness! Show me how much it hurts! \nYour sadness now, your blood before me, it is not enough! \nI cannot win with this alone! I cannot win!
Now, say I've won. Give me your compliments. \nYou there, well-roasted mother. You there, crimson soaked siblings. \nTell me I am the perfect family member…

[Investigative report] The ring found at the home of the suspect belongs to a woman reported missing (25 years of age, employed in the apparel industry). This was confirmed thanks to an original number engraved on the ring at the store of purchase.

We continue to question the suspect about the missing woman's whereabouts, but the suspect is in haggard physical condition and communication is difficult. Emotional instability is also evident and we expect it will take some time.

According to statements from Police Officer A, who was friendly with the suspect, the latter regularly wore expensive accessories or gemstones. However, no variety of gemstone has been located within the suspect's residence.

We have also failed to obtain information on gemstones from local pawn dealers and only one item was found at the house, itself in the beak of a dead crow. At present, all other items are whereabouts unknown. We will continue to investigate.

Q: Why did you participate in the cosplay, today? No one asked you to join. \nA: X-mas is my day. As the main character, I must be recognized above all others. Rather than Santa, people should direct their praise to a worthy elder, like me...

Q: Santa is also fairly elderly. \nA: I belong to the ancient literary tradition. Santa is merely an incarnation of modern consumer culture. …What's that? Santa goes back to the fourth century? And just what year is that?

Q: Umm, it's getting late and time for us to go.\nA: I haven't finished speaking yet! Why, these days, the young ones think of X-mas as a day for courting between men and women. It's disgusting! (excerpted)
A: ...therefore, these young ones should praise me and shower me with gifts not only on X-mas but on a daily basis... eh? They're gone. Just who have I been talking to, then...

Q: How do you feel about cosplay culture in general?\nA: I can certainly understand the desire to become something else. \nHowever, I think those who find justice in their own selves should stay as they are.

Ｑ: You say that, but you too wore a costume this time.\nA: Even if it departs from their own taste, one should still honor the dress code. \nI was invited to this special event, so it was important to follow etiquette.

Q: But to be honest, it looks like you even photoshopped your picture? The bust size is not consistent...\nA: I swear I would never commit such deception!\nTo make false accusations without basis or evidence is unjust and should be punished.

Q: Fine then, how about a last word for the children, in the role of Santa. \nA: The good children will receive wonderful presents. For the bad children... I'm afraid you must be punished... The choice is yours.
Q: Why did you decide to try cosplay this time?\nA: What is cosplay? As long as I'm in red, \nI don't care what I wear. The blood spatter doesn't stand out, so it saves me a lot of work!
Q: Is there anything particular you like about today's costume?\nA: The red hood. Red always gives me energy. \nWhich means this is a perfect time to play with me!
Q: We'll take a raincheck. Is there anything you want for x-mas? \nA: Some robust playmates would be nice. \nI'd like them right now. Just sitting here talking has made me bored.
Q: Please wait until the interview is over. A final word for the readers please.\nA: I hate waiting.\nQ: Hey stop that! Oww!!
Q: We see you're in a reindeer costume. Do you like reindeer? \nA: I simply wear what I'm given...\nQ: So you'll wear anything? I see, I see.
Q: So if I told you to undress, you would do it?\nA: Huh?! Th-that's...hmm, what should I...\nQ: You're forgetting your duty as a puppet. It dulls your character.
Q: I'm bored with this interview. Say whatever you like. \nA: H-Huh? This is too sudden. I don't know what to say.\nI can't think of anything. Isn't there anyone to answer for me...?
Q: In that case, let's hear from your staff. Go ahead.\nA: Talking to the puppet is a waste of time! He has no sense of self. You adult dolls can play as you like!
Once there was a wolf and a sheep. The sheep questioned the wolf.\nQ: "Who helped you when you were injured?"\nA: "That's easy. The other wolves in my pack"

As if his answer was incorrect, the sheep before the wolf died and a new one appeared.\nQ: "What happened when you recovered and returned to your homeland?"\nA: "Naturally, the pack was worried and waited for my return."

One sheep after the other met their death. The ground before the wolf became a mountain of dead sheep.\nQ: "What did you do when you learned the wolves had been killed by the sheep?"\nA: "Stop it! I can't take anymore!!!"

With those words, the wolf bit the sheep and returned to itself. There were no more bodies before it. Realizing the sin it had repeated once again, the wolf grew enraged with itself and howled at the heavens.
It was a sight terrifying enough to chill the blood. However, the stronger the prey, the more a hunter's passion and courage grow. I grabbed my hunting rifle and set off for the heart of the forest.

I searched the mountains for an absurd period of many moons, but I never made any discovery. It was as if the gods were mocking me. It was only when I grew exhausted and collapsed in defeat, that it revealed itself to me.

The insane mass of bodies that reached my eyes was beyond description. The horror brought me back to life and I aimed my rifle. In doing so, those eyes that until then had been completely blank somehow met my own.

That was the last thing I remember. The idea that a small thing like myself could take so many lives is lunacy. Their blasphemous gaze was a bottomless abyss of pure black, as frightening as hell itself.

I heard a blubbery sound. Flecks of red meat stuck to the bottom of my foot. It was so small and helpless, I must have stepped on it without noticing. Weakness is a sin. I was that way once… I think.
Yes… I was a helpless kitten. A peculiar man picked up my tiny body. I remember them as nauseous but peaceful days. But one day, my owner disappeared.

He was taken off by someone and never returned. When I learned that those gentle hands which had so often caressed me were gone forever, I thought that I wanted strength. If I had power, I could have protected him. Protect… who?
After an endless time passed, my distant memories grew vague and meaningless.\n In the end, I gained the power I sought. An ominous power.\n But now, I can longer remember what I wanted to defend.
Having lost both his parents at a very young age, this kind-hearted 16 year old boy lived peacefully in a modest home in the country with his ailing younger sister.
His sister meant everything to him. No matter the toll it took on him, no matter how badly bruised and battered he became, he would take up any job to be able get the medicine she needed.
For anyone that contracted the illness, death was certain. And as death creeped closer and closer to her, his anguish grew. Then one day, he came upon a strange grimoire. One that could speak.

He then discovered that the secret to curing his sister was hidden within the sealed verses hidden within the grimoire. Verses that were some how part of his memory, but gone from it as well. To save his sister, the boy set off to find them.
My brother is the best!\nHe gets work from just about everyone in town.\nI wish I could help...
He's also the nicest!\nHe cooks all kinds of food, just for me!\nI wanna cook for him some day...
Not only is he nice, he's also really strong!\nEven those baad, baad sheep can't take him!\nBut I still worry, I hope he's okay.
I can't let him see me get worse. I can't add this on to his already weary heart.\nMy body is slowly turning, it hurts so much, and I am so scared.\nBut I have to be the Yonah he's always known.
I feel sick just from breathing this awful rotten air. Why was I born? Even in my broken state, I must fight, it's all I can do. As if I was some kind of puppet being controlled by my own fate.
Make them cripple, shred 'em to bits. Pound them into mince meat. My thirst for blood is endless. My heart wishes it to end, yet my body seeks it.
When will the charade come to an end? Screams, ridicule, shouts—they do not reach me. I just kill, and kill, and kill, and kill, and kill. I...
No, no, no, no. I may be broken. I may be a monster. But there are people out there that call me friend. I fight for them.
A long, long, time ago, I ran my very own shop! Yup, I was quite the business person. What did I sell? Umm, I uh... I sold secrets!
A long, long, time ago, I fought a whole bunch of aliens! It sure was tough. They looked pretty icky and uh, yeah, at any rate, they were really, really, tough, okay?
A long, long, time ago, I got pulled apart bit by bit! Getting myself back together was tough. But with a little magic, ta-dah! Back to being me. Magic sure is cool, huh?
A long, long, time ago, I went on a journey! Whenever I try to remember, I get this stiffness in my chest, and I get all warm and fuzzy inside...

These twins lived a fairly easy life out in a frontier village.\nThey spent their days at peace, singing songs reading books, and what not.\nUntil one day, they started to question their relationship.
The elder sister thought,\n"If I didn't have a twin, I wouldn't have to run all her stupid errands!\nWhy, oh why, did I have to be born a twin?"
The younger sister thought,\n"If I didn't have a twin, I wouldn't have to make excuses for all her drunken rampages!\nWhy, oh why, did I have to be born a twin?"
However, when it came time for the twins to part ways,\nthey realized something. In order to survive in a cold lonely world,\nfamily is what makes the time pass easier.
We (were once I) are carbon copied weapons of face destruction!\nWe can go anywhere, multiply everywhere, and shoot laser beams some...whereANYWHERE!\nNice to make your acquaintance!
WOW! We sure landed in a cozy little world, huh.\nEveryone out there, just trying to revive their authors and stuff.\nReally ups the ol' motivation!
Everyone looks so...dangerous, too!\nThe thing is, it's not just me, its WE! A whole BUNCH of we!\nThere's an ene-we, a we-apon, simply too many we to count!
Hold on, we just got a message from Me #12682!\nOh, boy. A rival guild just spent a whole lot of money to power themselves up.\nTime to whip out the ol' we-paid credit card and spend big!

I'm a king. A cruel wolf king stronger and bigger than them all. There was no greater entertainment than screams of sheep echoing in the snowy mountains. But the high of ripping up prey soon disappeared with the sudden avalanche.

When I came to, a sheep was peeking at me worriedly. What's more, I had been treated for injuries. Fools. I'll gobble every last one of them up when I'm healed. That's what I thought, but one day I started to be charmed by the friendly sheep.

I was astonished when my injuries healed and I returned to my pack. I heard that many of my friends died in the sheep's trap. They're too kind to do such a thing. After leaving my comrades who were howling for revenge, I hurried to the sheep.

"I only took revenge," said the sheep. But I can't hate them. The sheep who taught me love was as important as my friends. If they every come into conflict against each other, I will have to kill everyone...

When the detective stepped foot on the scene of the crime, the bodies of a young woman and middle-aged man were lined up side by side. Nearby, a middle-aged woman, the man's wife, sat stunned, mumbling to herself.

When questioned, the seated woman could barely utter a response. "I knew he was having an affair, but I never expected this…", she whispered, followed by repeated coughing. The site of her husband lying in the arms of a young woman, both having died during sexual intercourse, would shock anyone.

Recently, however, there had been several strange deaths of people with unusual sexual appetites. When the detective informed the wife of that, she smiled. "It is proof of his sin and punishment from the gods. He was punished by the one."

Watching the woman as she immediately began a strange prayer in an unfamiliar language, the detective gulped and unconsciously stepped backward. Out of the corner of his eye, he glimpsed an unusual shadow, shaped like a scorpion, as something departed the scene.
Please tell me. What am I to do?\nAfter all, I'm just a puppet. I can't move unless someone pulls my strings.\nThe words of others are those strings. They are my lifeline.
Such a terrible scene.\nBut I am unmoved. The sight of tragedy or suffering does not reach my heart.\nAfter all, it's not my fault. It's what someone else wanted.
Where do we go next? What do we do? Which foot should step forward, first? \nHow many times should I blink? When should I breathe?\nTell me! What am I to do?!
The only one who would answer me was this hideous staff.\nAll the ones who didn't answer don't deserve to live. \nIn that case, they should all disappear.

Tax Audit of Aladdin: Final Report\nAfter a thorough investigation, there were no suspicious elements found in Mr. Aladdin's financial records.\nThis audit is now concluded.

Both ministers had a fortune in gold coins in their pockets and the weight appears to have…

She was born into a poor peasant household in the countryside. In her childhood, she journeyed to the city and found work in a factory. There she labored, covered in coal and oil, expected to do as much work as any grown man, and sending every cent she earned back to her family.

She had no time to learn the ways of beauty, and never managed to turn anyone's head, but one day a certain wealthy young man saw her, and, admiring her unwavering effort and resolve as she worked, fell in love. It was her first love.

However, only a scant few months later the young man married another girl, one who's complexion had never been blackened by coal dust. Looking down at the grime caked on her own skin, the girl was suddenly overwhelmed with a black hatred, and she raged at herself, how low, and mean, and foolish she must seem.

So, she reinvented herself, learned the use of cosmetics, the manners of the wealthy classes, and procured an education for herself. This went on until the day she realized she'd progressed enough to be named amongst the top of society. She didn't know at the time, that history would come to remember her as an infamous villain.

In era long gone. There was a man. The man, trapped in hierarchical stagnation, becomes a eunuch and takes his first steps into the world of politics. The man served a single concubine. Her name was Megumi. She was a beautiful but modest and fickle woman.

The love that the concubine receives from the emperor is tied to the man's power. Since Megumi was modest even in the bedroom, the man got an elixir. Caged Scorpion. Scorpion poison corrupts a person into debauchery. He advised her to use it on the emperor at their next rendezvous.

The next thing he knew, the emperor would frequently visit the concubine, raising the man's rank. He was pleased. This is because the man himself gained power. But one day the woman died. The cause of death was a drug overdose. The man finally realizes...

It was the woman who was taking the scorpion poison. It is unknown what she could have been thinking, pumping such poison into herself. But the beautiful yet sad profile of her, as she always stood by window, was burned into his heart.

These twins lived a fairly easy life out in a frontier village.\nThey spent their days at peace, singing songs reading books, and what not.\nUntil one day, they started to question their relationship.
The elder sister thought,\n"If I didn't have a twin, I wouldn't have to run all her stupid errands!\nWhy, oh why, did I have to be born a twin?"
The younger sister thought,\n"If I didn't have a twin, I wouldn't have to make excuses for all her drunken rampages!\nWhy, oh why, did I have to be born a twin?"
However, when it came time for the twins to part ways,\nthey realized something. In order to survive in a cold lonely world,\nfamily is what makes the time pass easier.

This is the tale of a tiger, consumed by its gourmet tastes. Unable to forget the delicious flavors that lived in its memories, the tiger embarked on a journey with a clever little mouse. Along the way it borrowed strength and wisdom from many others, a rabbit, a bird, a crocodile, a frog, a deer...to put together the ultimate full course meal.

Yet none of it lived up to the flavors it remembered. At last, the mouse offered to let the tiger eat it. The tiger refused, but the mouse insisted the flavor of its memory must have been a mouse. Terribly conflicted, the tiger...
CHOMP! Gobbling up the mouse, who had itself insisted, the tiger was unsatisfied, and after that fell into a deep sadness, eventually dying of despair.

The tiger's terrible death and the strength of its gourmet obsession transformed it into a terrifying spirit. Why had it had to die? Why had the mouse agreed to be eaten? Those are stories for another day. In the end, no one lived happily ever after.
Dear XXX,\nI heard from your teacher that you would be taking a break due to your illness.
The class wrote you a letter and folded a thousand paper cranes wishing you good health and to see you back at school soon. I hope you'll hang it in your hospital room.
Your teacher, classmates, my mom and dad... They hope the best for you. I do, too.\nYou're always in our hearts.
I'm really jealous of you.\nI wish I were sick and everyone felt bad for me.\nAren't you lucky.
One day, Aladdin had met a girl who had lost her family. He spoke to the crying girl. "You poor thing... How about I propose to you a new business model? That's sure to make you smile."

Aladdin then proceeded to pay people to become the girl's new family. She was given a new father, mother, siblings, grandparents, and even a dog and a cat. "With money, you can even buy a family. Monetization is the ultimate solution!"

But it wasn't long before the girl's joy wanned. Her new mother was too absorbed spending her pay in self-pleasures. Her father viewed her an an obscene object, and her siblings only flattered her for more money. No one truly loved her.
Before he knew it, the girl had disappeared. Aladdin then said to the family members, "No worries. I'll just get you a replacement!" And so a new girl joined the 'family'.
It's all nonsense. The notion that fans can kill people, or that hiding a jewel in his mouth slowed the theif's escape. Even I know it's all laughable nonsense.
That's why I learned. It is foolish to indulge in greed. That limitless want will consume your life, spread until there's nothing it hasn't touched, and bring about your downfall.
I spread my raven wings, straightening. Having expunged the greed from my soul, even the sky seems fresher, clearer, somehow.
Ah...but, there is one thing I regret. If my mouth hadn't fallen open at the moment of death, that lovely emerald ring might have been mine!
【XX Month, XX day　Clear skies】Today, father taught the child how to fish for salmon. I hope he can grow into a great bear. Still, I think father was a bit too strict. I will discuss this with him.
【XX Month, XX day　Cloudy】I talked to father today. But he screamed at me not to talk back. He climbed atop me and raised his great paws to strike. The child must have been so frightened.
【XX Month, XX day　Rainy】Father was killed by a human today. Strangely, I don't feel sad. Now, the child and I can live happily together. I need never fear his brutality again.

【XX Month, XX day　Lightning】Once again, the child would not emerge from his room, today. When I try to talk to him, he throws objects and growls in a display of brutality. He's just like his father. How am I to live from now on?

—First place in the Gran Election! Who'd of thought, eh? How ya feeling about it all?\nSnow White: Though it was only a child's game, I'm proud of the results. Those who voted for me, I give my deepest thanks.
—So, spill the beans. How'd you do it?\nSnow White: Me? This is the result of justice and what I fight for. My actions alone spoke to the voters. Justice will always prevail.

—How come your clothes are so revealing? Perhaps being looked at by pervy eyes is your fetish?\nSnow White: Never. My body is pure and undefiled. There is no need for me to hesitate. My body is for my author alone.

Snow White: However, I will not be taken advantage of. Those who voted for me for their own twisted pleasure, I will mur—\n—Unfortunately, we have to cut this interview short due to explicit language! Thank you again for your time!
Tower (noun)\nA tall building. In addition to military defense facilities that overlook the ground from high places, some possess religious meanings. ("He climbs a tower.")
Confinement (noun)\nTo lock away someone or something in a certain place. Outings are not allowed, and any connections to the outside are severed. ("She is held in confinement within the tower.")
Hair (noun)\nA threadlike outgrowth from the human head. Appears in various colors such as black, brown, gold, or red depending on the individual. Very durable. ("Long hair hides many faults.")

Chastity (noun)\nTo be pure of heart and mind. Even one were to engage in a physical relationship with the opposite sex, it is of no matter if one does not acknowledge it as such. ("the maiden's chastity")
As a child, I think I was quite strong-willed. I was aiming to become a great prime minister like my father, so perhaps the thought that I had to be strong made me that way.

When I first met Lelouch and Nunnally, who came from Britannia as hostages, I said some terrible things. But the more I interacted with you guys, the more I learned that there are many different kinds of Britannians.
When I close my eyes, all I can remember is that time. Before Britannia invaded. Lelouch, Nunnally...the days we all played. Those memories will never fade away.
Lelouch. Together, there's nothing the two of us can't do.\n...But you killed Euphy. She wanted peace more than anyone else. If you say it was for your ideals, I'll kill you...
Back then, I had my mother, and my sister Nunnally's eyes and legs were still fine.\nShe was always so energetic and bouncing around that it annoyed us...\nI was always chasing after Nunnally.
...And Euphy. She too, along with her sister Cornelia, often came to visit the villa here. I'm sure you'll be pleased to know that I'm not the only one who's a fan of your work.

Looking back, those were probably the happiest times of my life. My mother was assassinated, and Nunally, who was involved, lost her sight and ability to walk...\nMy father, the Emperor, drove us to Japan as hostages.
But in that Japan, I was able to gain a friend, you.\nSuzaku... What I want is a peaceful world. It's a gentle world where Nunnally can live happily. And for that purpose...I...
I have forgotten the time when I lived as a human being. Beyond the hazy memories, all I can see is the greedy desire to be loved by everyone and the cold shiver of loneliness.
When I got this body, I was called a witch. Well, I suppose so. I can't die or grow old. It's no wonder they call me that, since I go around giving people the strange power: Geass.
There were times when I felt that this power gave me happiness.\nBut it was all just a trick.\nI wonder what the happiness I was looking for was...
Lelouch. You who knows my wishes, my accomplice. The Power of Kings, Geass, will make you lonely.\nBut still, you... No, perhaps not...
Suddenly, I remembered. When I was a child, I often went with my sister Cornelia to visit the Aries Villa where Lelouch and the others were.\nMarianne welcomed us kindly.
I had a lot of chats with Lelouch's sister, Nunnally. We argue about which one of us would become Lelouch's wife. Heh. It's a faint memory from my childhood.
Sometimes I wish I could go back to those days. But then when I became governor of Area 11, I might not have met you. And you wouldn't have become my Knight.
I want to create a kind world where everyone can be happy. For that, I have to do what I can. Hey, Suzaku. Did I make the people of Japan happy? Did I...make it work...?
We used to be happy. My mother, brother, and I lived a modest but happy life together. It was one of those normal families that you can find anywhere.
I was half-Britannian and had a different father from my brother. But it didn't matter. My brother really loved me, and I loved him.
Everything has changed since the day Britannia invaded Japan and took over as Area 11. I could have lived as a Britannian, but I chose to be an Eleven—to be Japanese.
In place of my brother, I will take back Japan from Britannia.\nAs a member of the Black Order, I will definitely save the Japanese people.\nFor that, I need a good leader, Zero. But he is...

A mysterious figure who hides behind a mask. He leads the Order of the Black Knights, an anti-Britannia organization in Japan—now known as Area 11—that has been taken over by the Holy Britannia Empire.

No one knows Zero's true identity. With only his divine wisdom and charisma, he was able to seize the hearts and minds of the people and bring together a what had previously been an insignificant rebel force to create the Black Knights, a major force in the world.
Although he is a leader, he’s not afraid to go into battle himself, and sometimes engages in direct combat with the Britannian army, driving the Nightmare Frame, a mobile weapon.

Zero's true identity is Lelouch, the 11th prince of the Britannian Empire. In order to find out the truth behind the assassination of his mother Marianne, who was one of the princesses, and to gain the happiness of his sister Nunnally, the boy put on the mask of Zero.
I beg that future generations heed the warning on these pages.\nYou mustn't think that anger can save you.\nThat way lies only destruction, bought with endless atonement.
Anger is such a primitive emotion.\nTo embrace it? One of the baser sins.\nA sin we bear from the time of our birth, as we wander this world.

If the world of the eternal should ever fill up with the anger of the living,\na spear of brilliant blue lightning would cut through the darkness.\nThose pierced by such a light, touched over and over by the bolt of justice will surely not fall to sin.

No, they will become as wolves, devouring and snuffing out all those who did fall into the depths of sin.\nThere is no way for them to flee fast enough, no prayer that could possibly win them mercy.\nThat blinding blue light, stark and ruthless. The tears that will never cease, even should every sin face judgment.

The Three Little Pigs related a story to a tired looking bear.\n\nThere were once brothers, born to a fabulously wealthy household. Their parents died tragically, and each brother left to lead very different lives after claiming their inheritence.
The elder worked as hard as he could from dawn to dusk, and saved almost every cent he made, living a very simple life. He was exhausted and worn, but built a very tidy nest egg for himself.

The younger bought whatever it was his heart desired, and spent every day lost in leisures. He was happy all the time, but his money gradually dwindled. Decades later, they both grew old and died. The end.

"What?" said the bear, quite confused.\n\n "It means we're all going to die someday, so it's best to be happy and have fun while you can!" exclaimed one of the pigs. "Exactly!" Then, the bear and the Three Little Pigs all lived happily ever after eating and sleeping and doing pretty much exactly as they pleased.
Stay indoors if you hear a whistle.\nThe blustering winds will sweep you away.
Don't hang onto beautiful things.\nA man will come and take you away.
Don't obstruct the grave.\nSomeone might have taken them away.\nThey may be searching for a way out.
Keep your breaths faint.\nWait for night to pass.\nHide your beautiful treasures under the bed.

Q: How does it feel to try out cosplaying?\nA: It's a pretty fun culture. It's a pretty striking experience, dressing up in something you'd never normally wear. Getting into the role, like: "What is it you wish, Mistress."\nQ: Gah, how do you DO that? That voice is sex incarnate!

Q: That outfit really suits you, too.
A: Thanks. It's pretty refreshing wearing something meant to support my Mistress.
I haven't really had any experience supporting another, since I went from being to a pauper to a prince so suddenly, and all.
Q: Let's try to cut back on the blatant self promotion, alright?

Q: Why don't you tell us what you think about Halloween, if anything?\nA: Hm. Well, I think of it as an opportunity to demonstrate some of my core competences, although I can't say if that translates into any practical leverage, so...\nQ: English, please.

Q: Alright, to wrap this up, is there anything you'd like to say to the audience?
A: "Mistress, I am at your command, please do with me as you wish."
...Kidding! Hah, you're actually blushing!
Q: Alright, this the Halloween Event, not the Seductive Voice event, so save it for another time.
Q: That outfit really suits you! \nA: Gh...Why am I the only one who has to wear this...?\nQ: Well, everyone just wore what was available, right? You mean you didn't have fun?
Q: Do you enjoy this kind of thing, then?\nA: What kind of thing do you mean?\nQ: You know...well, nevermind.

Q: What did you think of this year's Halloween?\nA: (Interviewee is yanked off stage.) This guy'l never give you a straight answer, so I'd better field this one. It sucked! I don't think you people could have put together a worse story if your tried!\nQ: Oh, dear. Is that so? Terribly sorry, hehe!

Q: Alright, how about a closing statement? You can't expect to be coddled all the time!
A: What? Was...that a question?
Q: What's the point of asking you anything, Dollface?
A: ...You may have a point. Perhaps.
Q: How did you like cosplaying? Was it a lot of fun?\nA: Hansel...was wonderful...\nQ: I see. I'll take that as a yes.

A: Have you considered occasionally hanging out with guys who aren't your brother?\nA: Hansel...Hansel is the most wonderful...\nQ: Okay, so. I kind of feel like we're having two different conversations, here.

Q: How about you tell me what you thought about the Halloween event this year?\nA: Halloween...? I wonder if Hansel likes pumpkin?\nQ: He does have certain pumpkin-like qualities, if you think about it.

Q: Right, so, just give us a few parting thoughts, then.\nA: Hansel...I'm right here. Right by your side. I always will be. I'll make whatever sweets you like the most, Hansel. Hansel, Hansel...\nA: 'Hansel' seems to make up a truly alarming proportion of your vocabulary, Gretel.

Q: Nobody asked you to dress up like that.\nA: That's not a question, and you know, back in my day, kids knew how to ask a proper question, and more importantly, how to respect their elders! Why shouldn't a venerable pillar of the community such as myself dress up? Why should the kids have all the fun?

Q: Right. Okay. So what, are you supposed to be a cook?\nA: You will refer to me as the head chef, if you please! I've honed the art of mouse cuisine to the utmost level.\nTo such a level, indeed, that my mere presence in any cooking competition would blow my rivals out of the water.

Q: Annnyway... Could you just say a few SHORT words about Halloween? Just a few.\nA: Did you know that Halloween itself is a remnant of an old Celtic festival called Samhain? Pronounced Sah-when, mind you... Why, indeed, it was an autumnal harvest festival, and a ceremony to placate spirits. It came to be known as Halloween in later days, being celebrated on All Hallows' Eve, because that was the style at the time...

"I've just barely gotten used to the last world I was at. Now I gotta go through all that all over again?! I didn't even get my date with Emilia yet!"

"Everyone I met in that world means everything to me... I can't just give up. Still, that pretty silver-haired lady in this world is relentless. Why must the thorns of beautiful roses be so sharp?!"

Emilia was summoned to this world about three months ago. Thrown into this unknown world, she was all alone. No even having the ability to summon her kitten, a spirit named Puck.

Fortunately for her, she understood this world's language. And though this place was a bit twisted from her own, it was still similar in many ways. Still, not one person found this silver-haired half-elf strange.
The people in her own world avoided her because of her resemblance to the Witch of Envy, the one who caused the Great Calamity. Being in this new world felt like she was free to just be herself.
...But I still want to go back home. I belong in that world. Besides, I promised Subaru a date. I have to keep my promise.
The red-haired man known as a "Sword Saint" gave a refreshing smile as he defeated the beast with a single blow.\n"You're not hurt, are you, Miss?"
Before he knew it, he was in a strange place. And before him was an unfamiliar woman being attacked by a peculiar beast. Without a moment to think, he dashed forward and crushed the nightmare.

From listening to the woman's story, he learned that he was no longer in Lugunia. In fact, this was a completely different world. Though this was an unknown world to him, as a knight who could not ignore those in need.
However, it was not this world Reinhard's sword was for. It was Lugunica's.\nAlthough secretly impatient to return to his own world, he went on his way to become a Sword Saint here as well.
"Is this a dream? Or a nightmare? Not that it really matters. I don't mind getting involved with Barusu's antics, but I don't want to cause any trouble."
"Is this Barusu's dream that I'm viewing? If so, he's got a bad taste in worlds. It doesn't look very different from our world, but there's something off about it. First of all, the air is horrible."

"This place looks more like something from...an old fairytale.\nDoes Subaru have something for beautiful women with silver hair like Emilia? Neither Rem nor I can figure out what's so great about this guy."
"If Rem is in this world, I have to save her and wake up from this dream together. I wish she could wake up from those wrong feelings about Barusu, too... But I don't think she can."

Several young girls sit inside a dark room without a single window. The expressions on their faces vacant. How could you blame them? They were fated to be sold as slaves. One of the girls had blue hair.
...I don't care if I'm a slave. My life has no worth living.\nThe girl unconsciously touches her forehead.\nAlmost as if confirming if "something" was there.
...When I came to, there was no one here. Before I knew it, I was taken away by some scary men. I'm not even sure if I had a family. But I think...there was someone important to me.
A single thought was stuck in her mind—"I don't belong here." It was that thought that pushed her to run. She found a way to escape security, guided by a faint light.

Since ancient times, nothing has been more revered than the bond between blood relatives.\nThe Three Little Pigs born here were no exception, and were well known in the neighborhood.
"We'll share all our joy and happiness, sorrows and anger."\n"We'll be together in both life and death."\n"We'll share everything."

When the trio left their parents to build their own homes, the sisters made a vow to each other: "No matter where we live, we'll always be together."\nAnd their vow remained unbroken even when attacked by the big bad wolf.

The wolf, having eaten the eldest two sisters, was then served justice when the youngest piggie boiled him inside a pot. Afterwards, she too entered the pot where both her juices and the juices of her sisters inside the wolf stirred together, thus fulfilling the sisters' vow.

I visited a strange country for my apprenticeship. On top of the tens of thousands of rules, the people lived their lives under a mask. But in that country there was a boy who saved me from living alone.

By law I was prohibited to speak, but he made friends with me regardless. And he...didn't flinch when seeing the burn marks on my face. To me he was a prince. Although, it's ironic now he's the king of that country...

I'll never forget the day he confessed his feelings for me. It's a memory I'll forever treasure. For someone who spoke so confidently, that day he appeared a bit timid. I nodded in response, but his mask prevented me from seeing his reaction.

It is now the night before our wedding. If I am allowed to speak tomorrow, I already know the first words I'll say to him. Recalling the meaning of those words, he exhaled sleeping soundly besides me.
This is scary... Where the heck am I?\nNo light. No wind. No sound. Nothing.\nBut most importantly, my brother's missing...
How long have I been in here?\nIt was then I suddenly felt I wasn't alone.\nWhatever this presence was, it felt just like me. Sad and anxious.
I gently wiped away all the fear, anxiety, and suffering.\nAnd caressed ever so softly...\nIn doing so, it somehow put me at ease.
I thought I heard a voice calling out to me.\nI can't... I can't be in this place anymore.\nI'm sorry, brother... I love you.
[Match Divination: Shinku]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the calm, proud yet compassionate fifth doll Shinku?

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Alice]\nBoth have a deep affection for their author. However in Alice's case, she will take whatever means necessary for her author. A clash may occur due to a difference in opinions.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Snow White]\nTime spent with the righteous Snow White should be rather pleasant. However, it would be best to avoid discussions of morality before it turns into conflict without resolution.
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Dorothy]\nDorothy's curiosity fuels her lack of ethics, making her the worst possible match. Keep away from her or she may find a way to use you.
[Match Divination: Suiginto]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the brutal, cynical yet longing for love first doll Suiginto?
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Alice]\nYou both have a love-hate relationship with their author.\nAn open conversation may be the beginning of a promising friendship.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Cinderella]\nDue to an equally cunning nature, this would be an unfortunate paring. Every conversation would turn into a battle of mockery and sarcasm. It would be best to stay away.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Red Riding Hood]\nTerrible chemistry. Red Riding Hood is a cold-blooded murder, the very definition of "garbage." If you want to witness something truly broken, look no further.
[Match Divination: Suiseiseki]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the shy, criticizing yet gentle third doll Suiseiseki?

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Princess Kaguya]\nNot a good match. A gentle person such as yourself would never come to terms with Princess Kaguya's desire to be abused by someone stronger than herself.
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Rapunzel]\nNot a good match. Your heart is too pure to understand Rapunzel's need for a man.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Aladdin]\nAladdin's world revolves around money. You may pity him for his beliefs. Not even you could heal this man's heart in the dream world for it has since rotten away.
[Match Divination: Souseiseki]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the loyal, diligent yet fragile fourth doll Souseiseki?
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Pinocchio]\nPinocchio, who relies on codependency, may be similar to yourself as you need your twin. However, you are am to stand by yourself.
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Hansel and Gretel]\nGretel's crazed desire for her brother may consume you. However, unlike Gretel trapped in her own delusion, you can wake up.
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Hamlet]\nKeeping a distance from this man is advised. If he becomes your master, you'll offer your very being for the "beauty" he seeks.
[Match Divination: Kanaria]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the cheerful goof-up, yet collected second doll Kanaria?
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Nutcracker]\nThis old man will listen through one ear and out the other. Not worth the time or effort.\n"I gotta get outta here!"
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Three Little Pigs]\nDon't leave your lunch around these three. You might be out of one.\n"I hope they'll leave the fried egg at least!"
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Dorothy]\nTerrible chemistry. Dorothy may appear friendly at first glance, but her curiosity will disassemble you.\n"I won't let her near me!"
[Match Divination: Hinaichigo]\nWhich Library characters are compatible with the innocent and spoiled, yet brave sixth doll Hinaichigo?
[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Sleeping Beauty]\nNot a good match. Sleeping Beauty treasures her sleep more than anything. However, she'd make a good playmate when awake.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Little Mermaid]\nThis tragedy relishing mermaid will adore your tears. She will not be there to comfort you when you cry of loneliness, but rather watch your sorrow and beg for more.

[Diagnostic Results: Compatibility with Red Riding Hood]\nThe difference between your "play" and Red Riding Hood's "play" is black and white. The very moment you agree to the proposition, you will be torn to shreds.

Story [The Tale of Rimuru Tempest]
Satoru Mikami was just your ordinary corporate worker.
One day while walking along the street, he was suddenly stabbed to death by a passerby.
When he awoke, he realized his soul had reincarnated into an alternate world as a slime. In this new world, he took on the name Rimuru.
In this world, Rimuru tried eating all sorts of things.\nHe paid close attention to the effects of each thing he ate and took advantage of its strengths.

During his journey, he became friends with various demons.\nFighting alongside each other, they learned the value of friendship regardless of their race. He became popular with everyone and seemed to have friends everywhere he went.
Rimuru and his demon friends aimed to form a country where humans and demons alike could live together as equals.\nAcross the land word spread of their endeavors and soon the rest was history.
Story [The Tale of Shizue Izawa]\nOnce upon a time, there was a girl who was burned to death from an air raid. However, her body was summoned to an alternate world and was given the name Shizu.

Although Shizu's life was saved, her body eventually succumbed to a fire spirit. This led to a tragic incident where she killed a dear friend. It is later when she encounters a hero that she learns to find peace with herself.

If it weren't for the fire spirit, Shizu wouldn't have lived for as long as she did. She spent her many years training until she became strong enough to be called a hero. After that, she taught children she met on her travels how to fight.
But this long journey of hers would sadly come to an end soon after her encounter with the slime Rimuru.\nBut her soul can now rest in peace. Surly those she taught on her travels wish the same.
Story [The Tale of Shuna]\nLong ago there was a clan of demons known as ogres.\nThe ogres had a young princess whose brother was in line to lead the clan. She loved her brother dearly.

But one day the ogre clan was assaulted by a powerful demon. Including the princess and her brother, only six of them managed to escape the onslaught.\nIn the end, their people and homeland were lost.

Unable to bear reality, the princess ran away. It was then that she met a slime named Rimuru.\nDue to a misunderstanding, Rimuru gets mixed up in a fight with the ogres. Rimuru forgives them by giving them each a name as proof of their friendship. And from that day, the princess took on the name Shuna.

Rimuru assisted in the ogres long-awaited revenge.\nAnd even after justice was served, they chose to stay together. Shuna had lost everything dear to her, but thanks to Rimuru's new country she had a new place to call home. And the rest is history.
Story [The Tale of Milim Nava]\nThere once was a beautiful girl named Milim.\nDespite her appearance, she was incredibly strong and had lived many years.

Milim was the demon king, the strongest demon of them all. She could easily create a catastrophe with a snap of her fingers. Not one being stood a chance. And the boredom was more than she could take.
One day, Milim encounters a slime named Rimuru.\nShe was intrigued by the amount of knowledge the slime held.\nAfter years of boredom, she felt enjoyment in his presence.

Thanks to her good friend Rimuru and the country he created, her old life is now just a memory.\n Together with her newfound friends, her days are now filled with joy and laughter. And the rest is history.
Story [The Tale of Alice the Ogre]\nOne afternoon, a demon girl found a strange rabbit dashing through the grass.\nIt was holding a watch, panicking, saying, "I'm gonna be late!"

The demon chased the rabbit, but suddenly fell into a deep, dark hole.\nThe path twisted and turned, and when she landed, it was head first. Splurt!\nRight below her was the rabbit, pierced by her horn.

Tossing away the dead rabbit, the demon went on an adventure through Wonderland.\nThere she met a Caterpillar, a Cheshire Cat, a Hatter, and a March Hare.\nBut she found their attitudes to be quite annoying and used her powers to silence them all.

Dead bodies were scattered across Wonderland.
The Queen of Hearts cried out, turning pale.
"Off with this demon's—!"
But before she could finish, the demon girl had chopped of the Queen's head instead.
Story [Snow White the Slime]\nOnce upon a time, there was a beautiful stepmother with a heart of coal and a slime-girl with the heart of an angel.
One day the stepmother requested a hunter to kill the slime, but the hunter's bullets flew right through the slime's gooey body.

The stepmother's next attempt was to disguise herself as an old woman and offer the slime a poisoned apple.\nThe slime ate the poisoned apple, but since the poison was meant to kill humans it had no effect on her.
The slime covered the stepmother with its viscous body and absorbed her whole.\nThe next person she absorbed was the prince.\nAnd the rest is history.

"Murdering your entire family, all on some notion it'll grant you power?"\n"Idiocrasy. I rather not think of what fools would allow themselves to be consumed by such thirst."
"Would that make me a fool, too, Weiss?"\n"My boy, you... You protected. Someone who protects out of love is no fool."

"Power is yours! Don't you forget your anger and hatred, Kainé!"\nAs I laid dying, I was brought to life by an abominable creature.\nPossessing my insides, it sought me to kill.
"Kainé! It's an enemy! Kill it! Kill it now and bathe in its blood!"\nKilling is its pleasure. That's all it cares about.\nAnd before I realized it, I found pleasure in killing, too.
"Stay alert, Kainé! Something big is coming!"\nThe ferocity inside me blared like a siren.\nThough I mostly found it annoying, its voice was reassuring in the midst of battle.

"Hey, Kainé! We've got even more slaying tomorrow! Gahahaha!!!"\nHis words had found my bruised and blackened heart, forming the twisted bond we have now.\nAnd became my staple for life—the strength to keep me living for tomorrow.
Veiled by darkness inside a shipwreck was a girl distraught by her "monstrous" self. One day a man wandered into the ship and offered her kind words. For her, these words were like a ray of hope.
She tried to fix her "appalling" voice, all so the man wouldn't come to hate her. But when she practiced the songs he taught her, her words were horribly mangled.

She tried to fix her "hideous" appearance, all so she could be with the man. She believed that eating people would bring her closer towards becoming a real human. And so... She gobbled up all who approached the shipwreck. However, her right hand remained black.

The outside world shined bright in the sunlight. The girl, having exposed her "monstrosity" to this world, was rejected by the man. All hope she had was lost. Scorched by the sun's rays, she disappeared—her being as fragile as a bubble.

[Candy Apple Stall]\nBeing handed something so big all of a sudden is bothersome indeed.\nDo candy apples really have a whole apple inside?
[Festival Mask Stall]\nI already have one, so even if you say I can pick any one I like, it's a bother.\nHow should I wear the second one...?
[Corn on the Cob Stall]\nI keep telling you I don't want you to hand me food all of a sudden... It's bothersome.\nI think you should just give it to the people standing in line.
[Target Shooting Stall]\nI'm telling you I don't need any favors from you so...\nWait. Is that rabbit keychain a prize...? Then that's a whole other story. Let me show you what I can really do.
It's like a dream to enjoy a festival with you, dear brother.\nWasn't the cotton candy so delicious?\nWhy don't we take a look at some more food stalls?
Since it's such a hot day today, how about some shaved ice?\nIt comes with all-you-can-eat syrup!\nThere are so many flavors to try, I can hardly decide!
Strawberries and lemon, melon and green apples, or Blue Hawaii...\nSince we've got the chance, shall we try them all?\n...Ah, I'm sorry. I think I used too much!
The ice melted, and now all we have is just juice.\nHee hee! And you were just getting thirsty? That's so nice of you, dear brother.\nAnd that's what I love about you, too. Let's drink it together!
I've finished playing around with Nightmare in the freak show,\nso I'd like to go back and play games at stalls! I played all sorts of things a while ago,\nbut I want to try yo-yo fishing again!

[1st Retry]
I couldn't even fish one by myself, so the guy at the stall
just gave me a yo-yo as a consolation prize.
But I want to fish one myself!
[7th Retry]\nAw, I was so close that time! Don't you think? I think I finally got the hang of it though! Next time I'll definitely fish out a yo-yo!

[15th Retry]
It wasn't working out so well, so I tortured the stall guy a little.
Then he tried giving me a yo-yo, but I'm not accepting any more!
This is the final try, and I'm betting his life on it... I can't wait!
——Before the challenge: Katanuki Diecutting Stall\nAh... I see. So it's a game where you use a toothpick to cut out\na shape outlined on a candy? Then let's make something beautiful.
——1st Candy: 15 minutes later\nHm... This is more difficult than I had imagined.\nNo matter how careful I am, the narrow neck part always seems to break.
——5th Candy: 1 hour later\nI can't give up now. I have no intention of leaving here\nuntil I can make a clean and beautiful cut!

——30th Candy: 5 hours later
Ah, I finally made something that I'm satisfied with!
Truly beautiful! Now then, I must hurry and have my body consume it entirely!
...But how exactly?

When I awoke in the Library, I was in darkness. The scent of blood was thick in the air, and something slithered, unseen. Even so, I felt no fear. Somewhere beyond that darkness, I knew I  would find them.
I would revive my Author. To accomplish that task, I've destroyed many souls. I've taken innocent lives. I've drenched myself in blood, now able to kill in order to survive. ...However.
Even once I revive them, I'm certain... I'm certain we'll never meet. With all the blood that stains my soul, I haven't the courage to stand before them. Then, you ask, why do I fight at all?

Once I revive my Author, I'll have no need to live any further. I'll be satisfied, as long as they're revived. Realizing this, feeling the truth of it, my heart is curiously light.\nWith that hope in my heart, I take up my sword once more and set forth.
Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #1\n"We're all packed and ready to fly!" "World tour, here we come!" "You betcha!" "Our first feature is...the cheongsam!" "That's right! China, the home of ramen!"
"Pay attention. I told you, ramen is from Japan. The ingredients used aren't the same in China." "Oh yeah! I forgot there's that FUNKY sushi overseas, too!"
"I guess that means SINoALICE Global isn't going to be the same either, huh?" "Maybe yes, maybe no."
"Maybe we'll witness Alice donning a curly mustache with an assault rifle in hand! Wouldn't that be grand?!" "If you say so."\n\nAlice: "That would make me a different character."

"Ding-ding-ding! Looks like we got a winner here."\n\n(It's not that hard to G**gle it!)
"But why would a Japanese princess need to belly dance? She could have gone for something more traditional and princess-like."\n\nPrincess Kaguya: "Traditional? What I want is torment and lust."
Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #4\n"Around the world we go! This time it's a hanfu!" "Yippee!" "Hooray!" "But this is our second time to China." "Did we already go full-circle?!"
"Who cares. I hear this outfit's popular with the youngsters." "There's people who rent clothes for photoshoots, too." "Think it's possible to rent the one Snow's wearing?"

"You need courage to pull off one of Snow's outfits! She's our Gran Election winner after all!" "She's a maiden at heart, albeit a bit complicating. Let's rent her out as a whole then!" "A 100% reproduction!"
"Talk about a fantastic service!" "Gotta get as many pictures in during our trip to preserve this memory."\n\nSnow White: "Ask before renting people out!!!"
Parrah-Noya's Marvelous World Tour #3\n"Next up is Huayno!" "Woohoo! ...Ueno? You mean the zoo in Tokyo? Is it a panda suit?" "No, it's not a panda! Huayno!" "Right! International!"
"I was looking forward to seeing a panda though." "Huayno have a close relationship with alpaca though!" "Those cute, fluffy things?! I smell profits! So where do we sign?"

"Alpacas are surprisingly aggressive though." "Cute, yet brutal. Sounds about right for Red here. Now if we can just sell them as a set..." "Plus the alpacas without white fur are on the endangered list."
"We can't! That little monster will guarantee their extinction if they meet!"\n\nRed Riding Hood: "No wait! I just wanna play with them!"
